title: Bizarre sound issue
content:
When I switch from external speakers to Headset, Firefox (YouTube) continues to play on the external speakers (but not on the headset). Firefox remains present on the volume mixer for the EXTERNAL speakers, but does NOT appear on the volume mixer for the headphones.

YouTube on Chrome is working properly.

I have updated my drivers, I have "refreshed" Firefox.

Basically when toggling back and forth between my external speakers (Realtek(R) Audio default Device and Headset Earphone: CORSAIR VOID PRO Wireless Gaming Headset Default Multimedia Device) Firefox is always playing on external speakers regardless.
creator: anklebaub

title: Garbled text in emails going out
content: I have a new doctor with a portal I've not used before. When I send a message, it gets garbled. Example: "Iâ™m glad I pursued an elaboration of this report. It was mildly comforting as it says âœhas low malignant probability but does require follow-up." I donâ™t see a way to do an attachment so Iâ™ll cut and paste." The part I cut and pasted was fine. I am on Firefox 92.0.1 and a Mac Laptop. The previous version of Firefox did this too. In this message, it appears not to like apostrophes or quotation marks specifically. My doctor doesn't appreciate trying to decipher them and I am not happy that he can't read them without a problem since we are talking about a potentially serious problem causing me a lot of anxiety. What is the solution? And when will Firefox fix it so I don't have to each time? Thanks!
creator: barbarahunt
